name: diethyl 4-(4-fluorophenyl)-2,6-dihydroxy-2,6-bis(trifluoromethyl)piperidine-3,5-dicarboxylate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3735
Reason: 4-Fluorophenyl group: The fluorine substituents significantly increase the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 15 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (15 degrees Celsius x 4 fluorines) = 60 degrees Celsius.
